labkipackmanager-desc: Import Labki .wiki content packs from Git repositories and manage installed content.
labkipackmanager-summary: Manage and import Labki content packs into this wiki.
labkipackmanager-special-placeholder: This is a placeholder for the LabkiPackManager import UI.
right-labkipackmanager-manage: Manage Labki content packs and related data
labkipackmanager-error-dbviewer-disabled: The Labki database viewer is currently disabled by the site administrator.
labkipackmanager-list-empty: No packs found in the manifest.
labkipackmanager-ui-no-packs: No packs available for the selected source. Click Load or Refresh.
labkipackmanager-status-missing: No cached manifest found. Click 'Grab Manifest' to fetch.
labkipackmanager-error-fetch: Failed to fetch content pack manifest.
labkipackmanager-error-parse: Failed to parse content pack manifest (YAML error).
labkipackmanager-error-schema: Manifest format is invalid or missing required fields.
labkipackmanager-error-schema-version: Manifest is missing a valid schema_version.
labkipackmanager-error-unknown: An unexpected error occurred while loading the manifest.
labkipackmanager-error-permission: You do not have permission to manage Labki packs.
labkipackmanager-error-repo-not-found: The specified repository could not be found.
labkipackmanager-error-pack-not-found: The specified pack could not be found.
labkipackmanager-error-page-not-found: The specified page could not be found.
labkipackmanager-error-manifest-missing: Manifest file (manifest.yml) not found in worktree.
labkipackmanager-error-manifest-empty: Manifest file exists but is empty.
labkipackmanager-error-manifest-unreadab: Manifest file exists but cannot be read (permission denied).
labkipackmanager-error-manifest-read: Failed to read manifest file from worktree.
labkipackmanager-error-invalid-url: The provided URL is not a valid repository URL.
labkipackmanager-error-invalid-protocol: The URL protocol is not supported. Use https, http, git, or ssh.
labkipackmanager-error-repo-multiple-ide: Cannot specify both repo_id and repo_url. Please provide only one identifier.
labkipackmanager-api-repos-list-param-re: Optional repository ID to fetch a single repository. Mutually exclusive with repo_url.
Optional repository URL to fetch a single repository. The URL will be normalized before lookup. Mutually exclusive with repo_id.
apihelp-labkireposlist-description: Returns information about configured content repositories, including their associated refs (branches/tags), sync status, and metadata.
apihelp-labkireposlist-example-all: List all content repositories with their refs
apihelp-labkireposlist-example-by-id: Get details for repository with ID 1
apihelp-labkireposlist-example-by-url: Get details for repository by URL
